attributes.action: Stop Falkirk Council’s Proposal to remove home to school transport for children
attributes.additional_details:
However many parents work and this is simply not practical. 

*Children will have to cross very dangerous roads which have no crossing patrol or automated pedestrian crossings.

*During winter months children will walk home in the dark. 

*Proposed bus pass costs are too high

*Children in Scotland are entitled to free bus travel but they won’t put additional service busses on for school hours. 

Please help the people of Falkirk halt this proposal.
attributes.background:
Please stop our local council from trying to save money in a way that leaves children at risk. 

*Head of Education Services at Falkirk Council (Robert Naylor) has stated that it is the responsibility of parents to ensure that their children arrive at school safely.

rejection.details: Transport for children is a matter for local councils and matters relating to education and school transport in Scotland are a matter for the Scottish Government. You may wish to contact your local council. You can find contact details for this here: https://www.mygov.scot/find-your-local-council
